snippet: Elizabeth Warren, who is running for the Senate in Massachusetts, was accused of claiming American Indian ancestry to advance her career.
abstract: Elizabeth Warren, the likely Democratic challenger to Senator Scott P Brown in the closely watched Senate race in Massachusetts, responds to accusations that she used her American Indian ancestry to advance her career; releases statements from officials at all of the law schools where she has taught insisting that her hiring was based on merit; Brown campaign also casts doubts on claim of Native American ancestry, which Warren concedes is based on 'family lore'.

byline.original: By KATHARINE Q. SEELYE and ABBY GOODNOUGH

lead_paragraph: Elizabeth Warren, who is running for the Senate in Massachusetts, was accused of claiming American Indian ancestry to advance her career.

headline.seo: Elizabeth Warren’s Ancestry Irrelevant in Hiring, Law Schools Say
headline.main: Candidate for Senate Defends Past Hiring
headline.print_headline: Candidate For Senate Defends Past Hiring
